Key Match Events: Jake Meyers singled with one out in the ninth and scored easily from first when Altuve banged an 0-1 pitch from James McArthur off the left-field wall
Paul DeJong tied the game with a two-run homer in the top of the ninth off Houston closer Josh Hader
Post-Match Reflections: Altuve’s teammates mobbed him after Houston’s sixth walk-off hit of the season

Espada said, ‘He’s got all sorts of pitches, he changes his cadence, he throws a lot of strikes to balls. When we’re aggressive, we’re swinging, and it’s starting down the middle, but it’s a changeup or a curveball. He changes velocity a lot. He’s got a lot of movement. He’s been around awhile. He’s been a pretty good pitcher.’
Espada said, ‘Sometimes you’re just going to be human. He’s been outstanding.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Valdez threw 7 no-hit innings, needing 20 pitches to get through the seventh inning
The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, tying the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era (since 1961)
Valdez lost a no-hitter with two outs in the ninth inning on Aug. 6 in Arlington when Rangers shortstop Corey Seager hit a homer
Meanwhile, Astros rookie Spencer Arrighetti carried a no-hitter into the eighth inning on Wednesday in Philadelphia
